column2: Kimberly-Clark Corp. engages in the manufacture and marketing of products made from natural or synthetic fibers. The company is headquartered in Irving, Texas and currently employs 41,000 full-time employees. The firm's segments include Personal Care, Consumer Tissue, K-C Professional and Corporate & Other. The firm's Personal Care segment offers various solutions and products, such as disposable diapers, training and youth pants, swimpants, baby wipes, feminine and incontinence care products, and other related products. The firm's Consumer Tissue segment offers products, such as facial and bathroom tissue, paper towels, napkins and related products. The firm's K-C Professional segment offers solutions and supporting products, such as wipers, tissue, towels, apparel, soaps and sanitizers. The firm's business outside North America includes Developing and Emerging Markets (D&E) and Developed Markets. The company sells its products to supermarkets, mass merchandisers, drugstores, warehouse clubs and other retail outlets.
